title.narrative: One UN Joint Program on Education in Balochistan

description.narrative:
Pakistan is one of eight pilot countries for the “One UN” reform process, which aims to deliver effective joint UN programs at the country level, centred around four ‘ones’: one leader; one program; one budget; and one office. After an extended process of consultation and negotiations with government, civil society and donors, the Joint UN Education Programme was finalised and signed in March 2009.
The proposed assistance will target Joint Program Component 1: pre and elementary education in Balochistan, contributing towards improved pre and elementary school enrolment, retention and completion rates, especially for girls and other disadvantaged groups and improved learning outcomes for all children up to grade 8. This builds on Australia’s previous engagement in Balochistan and is in line with MDG and EFA goals and the objectives of the draft Pakistan education strategy, which highlights a focus on the border provinces of NWFP and Balochistan.
The proposed assistance will also
